sime.tcp

Class SenderReno

  • java.lang.Object
    • sime.tcp.Sender
      • sime.tcp.SenderReno
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TimedComponent
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SenderNewReno

    public class SenderReno
extends Sender
    TCP old Reno implementation of a sender that appeared first in early 1990s. TCP Reno followed TCP Tahoe, which was developed in late 1980s.
    This class does not implement a TCP NewReno sender.
    Author:
    Ivan Marsic
    See Also:
    SenderNewReno

    • Method Detail

      • onExpiredRTOtimer

        void onExpiredRTOtimer()
        This method resets the sender's parameters when a RTO timer timed out. It is very similar to SenderTahoe.onExpiredRTOtimer(), but only slightly different in how it calculates SSThresh.
        Specified by:
        onExpiredRTOtimer in class Sender
        See Also:
        SenderState

      • onThreeDuplicateACKs

        void onThreeDuplicateACKs()
        This method performs the so-called Fast Retransmit to retransmit the oldest outstanding segment because after Sender.dupACKthreshold dupACKs, it is presumably lost. It is similar to SenderTahoe.onThreeDuplicateACKs(), but different in how it calculates the sender's parameters.

        Unlike Tahoe, TCP Reno sender considers the number of duplicate ACKs in excess of the first Sender.dupACKthreshold dupACKs.

        Specified by:
        onThreeDuplicateACKs in class Sender
        See Also:
        SenderStateFastRecovery.handleDupACK(Segment)
